	We are seeking an experienced and proactive Quality Assurance (QA) Lead to oversee the quality control function across our production operations.
	This critical leadership role is responsible for maintaining our commitment to exceptional garment quality, driving continuous improvement, and coordinating the activities of the QA team to ensure all products meet or exceed our standards.
	The ideal candidate brings strong tailoring or fashion production expertise, proven leadership skills, and the ability to innovate and implement best practices in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

	Lead and coordinate the activities of the QA department to ensure consistent adherence to quality standards.
	Oversee inspections of finished garments for defects, finishing quality, and accuracy.
	Ensure alignment of products with customer specifications and approved order details.
	Identify quality issues quickly and recommend effective corrective actions.
	Develop and implement robust standard operating procedures (SOPs) for quality assurance processes.
	Bring new ideas and innovative approaches to improve product quality and department effectiveness.
	Collaborate closely with production, tailoring, procurement, and logistics teams to maintain seamless operational workflows.
	Maintain accurate and comprehensive quality inspection records and generate regular reports for management.
	Foster a culture of accountability, continuous improvement, and proactive problem-solving within the QA team.

	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree (B.Sc. or HND) in a relevant field.
	Minimum of 3&ndash;5 years of experience in quality assurance or garment production, with at least 2years in a supervisory or lead role.
	Strong knowledge of garment construction, tailoring techniques, and finishing.
	Proven ability to lead and coordinate a team in a production environment.
	Excellent attention to detail with a passion for delivering high-quality products.

	Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work proactively.
	Effective communication and collaboration skills across departments.
	Willingness and ability to work day and night shifts as required.
	Must reside in or near Ketu, Agboyi Estate, Lagos.


Compensation and Benefits


	Net monthly salary of 250,000.
	Opportunity for career growth within a dynamic and expanding fashion brand.
	Direct exposure to end-to-end fashion production processes.
	Supportive, respectful, and performance-driven work environment.

Quality Assurance (QA) Lead Job at BAFashion Shop




        
    

        
        BAFashion is a fast-growing fashion and lifestyle brand focused on offering trendy, budget-friendly, and quality clothing for the modern customer. Our aim is to create a smooth shopping experience through innovation, consistency, and excellent customer service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance (QA) Lead

Job Location: Ketu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced and proactive Quality Assurance (QA) Lead to oversee the quality control function across our production operations.
	This critical leadership role is responsible for maintaining our commitment to exceptional garment quality, driving continuous improvement, and coordinating the activities of the QA team to ensure all products meet or exceed our standards.
	The ideal candidate brings strong tailoring or fashion production expertise, proven leadership skills, and the ability to innovate and implement best practices in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and coordinate the activities of the QA department to ensure consistent adherence to quality standards.
	Oversee inspections of finished garments for defects, finishing quality, and accuracy.
	Ensure alignment of products with customer specifications and approved order details.
	Identify quality issues quickly and recommend effective corrective actions.
	Develop and implement robust standard operating procedures (SOPs) for quality assurance processes.
	Bring new ideas and innovative approaches to improve product quality and department effectiveness.
	Collaborate closely with production, tailoring, procurement, and logistics teams to maintain seamless operational workflows.
	Maintain accurate and comprehensive quality inspection records and generate regular reports for management.
	Foster a culture of accountability, continuous improvement, and proactive problem-solving within the QA team.


Requirements and Competencies


	Bachelor’s Degree (B.Sc. or HND) in a relevant field.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in quality assurance or garment production, with at least 2years in a supervisory or lead role.
	Strong knowledge of garment construction, tailoring techniques, and finishing.
	Proven ability to lead and coordinate a team in a production environment.
	Excellent attention to detail with a passion for delivering high-quality products.
	Innovative mindset with the ability to introduce new ideas and improve existing processes.
	Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work proactively.
	Effective communication and collaboration skills across departments.
	Willingness and ability to work day and night shifts as required.
	Must reside in or near Ketu, Agboyi Estate, Lagos.


Compensation and Benefits


	Net monthly salary of 250,000.
	Opportunity for career growth within a dynamic and expanding fashion brand.
	Direct exposure to end-to-end fashion production processes.
	Supportive, respectful, and performance-driven work environment.


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Access Network Planning Engineer Job at Equinix




        
    

        
        Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, operating over 260 data centers across the globe. Digital leaders harness Equinix's trusted platform to bring together and interconnect foundational infrastructure at software speed. Equinix enables organizations to access all the right places, partners and possibilities to scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences and multiply their value, while supporting their sustainability goals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Access Network Planning Engineer

Job ID: JR-151565
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Performs routine tests that support deployment readiness decision.


Responsibilities
Troubleshooting:


	Participates in the development of troubleshooting guides within a limited scope


Network Design;


	Supports translation of high level architectural designs into platform configurations ; support developing methods of procedure that implement the design changes in the network platforms


Commissioning/ Installations:


	Assists in creating engineering deployment packages (EDPs), including rack elevation drawings, space and power requirements, cable run lists, and any other site-specific documentation
	Completes documentation for use by Operations (EDPs, configurations, and training guides)


Testing & Validation:


	Supports developing and executing software test plans and procedures
	Supports hands-on tests to validate proof of concepts, network design, network deployment, and introduction of services and features


Vendor Management:


	System Integration & Testing
	Assists with the creation of new and innovative test strategies for tests in laboratory and field testing environments
	Develops scripts that are the basis for test automation and incorporated into a test automation framework
	Training


Qualifications


	1-3 years of experience required
	Bachelor's in Electrical Engineering, Electronics, Computer Engineering or related field preferred.

  "description": "Ponticelli Nigeria&nbsp; [PNL] is a subsidiary of Ponticelli Fr&egrave;res Group, a leading European services supplier to companies in the energy, industrial, and infrastructural sectors. PNL specializes in world-class construction and upgrade services for Oil and Gas facilities in the Nigerian market, both onshore and offshore.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Subsea Project Manager H/F

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers

	ensure compliance with the Group’s Quality, Safety, Health, and Environment (QSSE) policies throughout the project;
